result.execSummary:
The defendant Rachelle R. LYLES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.
It is hereby ordered the defendant's motion is denied for the reasons stated on the record.

Order Granting Furlough.
It is hereby ordered that a 30 day furlough is granted starting on Wednesday, February 22, 2017 at 8:30 a.m.
Copy delivered to jail.
Notice of Hearing returned "moved left no address".

CONTINUED MOTION TO MODIFY SENTENCE - 
Attorney Dewane states that the notes in the file indicate that Attorney LaBre spoke with the doctor on 02-17-17.  The notes regarding that conversation are read into the record.  The State continues to object to any modification of sentence.
The defendant comments.
The Court comments and finds no statutory reason to modify the sentence.  The motion is denied.
However, the Court is willing to grant the defendant a 30 day furlough in order to get arrangements made for the care of her mother.  The defendant will accept the furlough and would like that to begin on 02-22-17 by 8:00 a.m.
The State will prepare both the order for furlough and the order denying the motion.
Minutes.

CONTINUATION OF MOTION TO MODIFY SENTENCE - 
The Court and the State have received documentation regarding the defendant's mother's medical condition.
The document doesn't indicate what her mother's condition is, but only states that the defendant is needed at home to care for her.  Attorney LaBre has a call in to the doctor's office in order to obtain more information.
Motion hearing is reset to 02-20-17 at 3:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Motion hearing on February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

MOTION TO MODIFY SENTENCE - 	
The defendant states she is asking that her jail condition be shortened because of the need to get back to Michigan to care for her mother.  She indicates that her mother faxed her health records to the DA back in January.
Attorney LaBre states that she never received any fax and without this verification, finds it difficult to make an argument.
The defendant states she could have her mother re-fax it today sometime.
Motion hearing is reset to 02-16-17 at 9:00 a.m.
Minutes.

1) letter from defendant to Judge Bendix
2) letter from GLB to ADA Prost.
Motion hearing on February 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in custody on another matter.
Counsel waived.
Motion hearing is set for 02-15-17 at 8:30 a.m.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss the enhancer in Count 1, second or subsequent offense.   Motion granted.   
Count 1 - Deliver Cocaine - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 3.   Motion granted.    Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Report to be filed by 01-12-16.   Sentencing hearing is set for 01-26-16 at 11:30 a.m.  Court orders defendant to submit a DNA sample.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.  
Minutes.
Plea date reset for 11-20-15 at 11:30 a.m.
Plea Hearing (only) set for 10-12-2015 at 10:00 a.m., Br. 2.

Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 9/3/2015 at 3:00 p.m.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection; Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 07-17-15 at 3:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
Travis Schreurs, through Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 05-18-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail is furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
